id.description: Uniquely identifies an event. The data stream will occasionally send duplicate events. Duplicate events will have the same `id`, `type`, `occurred`, `device`, and `body` values but different `offset` and `processed` values. You should use the `id` to deduplicate.

offset.description: An identifier of a location in the stream; used to resume the stream after severing a connection. If you open a stream using the offset value, the stream will resume with the next element in the stream. You should store this value as a string so that you can easily resume the stream if it ends for any reason.

processed.description: When the event was ingested by Airship. There may be some latency between when the event occurred, and when it was processed.

type.description: Compliance events are the only types of events returned by this event stream.

oneOf.description: An event that occurs when an email could not be delivered to a particular address. The `bounce_class` can provide more information about why the message bounced.

body.description: Contains the event subtype and additional properties about the event.

bounce_class.description: The bounce classifcation as specified in Sparkpost.

sender.description: The address that the bounced email came from (typically the sender address for your project in Airship).

subject.description: The subject line of the bounced email.

device.description: Holds information about the email "device" (an individual email channel) the event occurred against.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

delivery_address.description: The email address of the channel the event occured against.

device_type.description: email compliance events use the EMAIL device type.

named_user.description: The named user that the channel is associated with; appears only if the channel is associated with a named user.

device.title: Email Device

oneOf.title: Email Bounce Event

oneOf.description: An event that occurs for email addresses used as a part of a create-and-send message.

body.description: Contains the event subtype and additional properties about the event.

address.description: The email address a message was sent to using the create-and-send (inline list) feature.

properties.description: Properties for an email create-and-send event.

channel_registered.description: If true, a new channel was created to represent the identifiers in the event. If false, the address was already registered to Airship.

commercial_opted_in.description: The date and time when the `address` opted into commercial email messages.

transactional_opted_in.description: The date and time when the `address` opted into transactional email messages.

device.description: Holds information about the email "device" (an individual email channel) the event occurred against.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

delivery_address.description: The email address of the channel the event occured against.

device_type.description: email compliance events use the EMAIL device type.

named_user.description: The named user that the channel is associated with; appears only if the channel is associated with a named user.

device.title: Email Device

oneOf.title: Email Create-and-Send Event Body

oneOf.description: An event that occurs when users register to receive email messages.

body.description: Contains the event subtype and additional properties about the event.

commercial_opted_in.description: The date and time when the user opted into commercial email messages.

registration_type.description: `create` indicates that a channel was created in Airship. `update` represents a `PUT` call to the email channel registration API.

device.description: Holds information about the email "device" (an individual email channel) the event occurred against.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

delivery_address.description: The email address of the channel the event occured against.

device_type.description: email compliance events use the EMAIL device type.

named_user.description: The named user that the channel is associated with; appears only if the channel is associated with a named user.

device.title: Email Device

oneOf.title: Email Registration Event

oneOf.description: A compliance event representing a user who unsubscribed from your email notifications.

body.description: Contains the event subtype and additional properties about the event.

event_type.description: Unsubscribe events are considered "registration" events; the "registration_type" indicates the type of registration occurring.

message_type.description: The message type that the user unsubscribed from.

device.description: Holds information about the email "device" (an individual email channel) the event occurred against.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

delivery_address.description: The email address of the channel the event occured against.

device_type.description: email compliance events use the EMAIL device type.

named_user.description: The named user that the channel is associated with; appears only if the channel is associated with a named user.

device.title: Email Device

oneOf.title: Email Unsubscribe Event

oneOf.description: Occurs when an SMS user is registered via the [SMS Channel Registration API](../ua/#operation/api/channels/sms/post) without an `opted_in` value â€” indicating that the user has initiated, but not completed, the registration process. While this event contains a `channel_id`, you cannot send messages to this channel until the associated user completes the opt-in process (indicated by a `mobile_opt_in` event).

body.description: Contains the event subtype, identifiers, and additional properties about the event.

event_type.description:
Indicates a registration was started via the Airship API without an opt-in date,
and a message was sent to the end user with instructions on how to opt in.

identifiers.description: Contains the sender and MSISDN for the event.

msisdn.description: The phone number of the user involved in the compliance event.

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

identifiers.title: SMS Identifiers

device.description: Holds information about an SMS "device" (an individual SMS channel).

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

delivery_address.description: The phone number for the channel.

device_type.description: SMS compliance events list the SMS device type.

identifiers.description: If present, the `identifiers` object holds the value for the `sender` property.

sender.description: The sender that the `delivery_address` received a message from.

device.title: SMS Device

oneOf.title: SMS API Initiated Opt In Event

oneOf.description: Occurs when an MSISDN is deactivated by a carrier. This event type does not contain additional `properties`.

identifiers.description: Contains the sender and MSISDN for the event.

msisdn.description: The phone number of the user involved in the compliance event.

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

identifiers.title: SMS Identifiers

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

opted_in.description: The date-and-time when the `msisdn` opted into messages from the `sender`.

identifiers.description: Contains the sender and MSISDN for the event.

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

inbound_message.description: The body of the inbound (to Airship) text message. This is the message a user sent to opt into or out of messages. This text corresponds to the `keyword` if present.

outbound_message.description: The message you sent to the user represented in the event.

delivery_address.description: The phone number for the channel.

oneOf.title: SMS Custom Keyword Response Event

oneOf.description:
If a channel does not exist for the MSISDN/sender combination and your account is configured
to create a channel if none exists in such instances, we will emit this event. The resulting channel will necessarily be opted out, awaiting an opt-in action by the user.

body.description: Contains the event subtype, identifiers, and additional properties about the event.

event_type.description: Indicates that a channel for the `sms` event type was created.

identifiers.description: Contains the sender and MSISDN for the event.

msisdn.description: The phone number of the user involved in the compliance event.

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

opted_in.description: The date and time when the channel was registered.

registration_type.description: Indicates that the channel was registered with Airship.

sender.description: The sender that the `delivery_address` received a message from.

device.title: SMS Device

oneOf.title: SMS Mobile Opt In Event

oneOf.description: Occurs when a user sends a MO message that matches a keyword with an opt-out action. If present, this event would supplant a `mobile_keyword_matched` event.

body.description: Contains the event subtype, identifiers, and additional properties about the event.

event_type.description: The event represents a user who opted out of notifications.

identifiers.description: Contains the sender and MSISDN for the event.

sender.description: The phone number or shortcode of the sender involved in the compliance event.

inbound_message.description: The body of the inbound (to Airship) text message. This is the message a user sent to opt into or out of messages. This text corresponds to the `keyword` if present.

keyword.description: Indicates that the user responded to opt out of messages. The enumerated values represent default keywords, but any custom keywords that you configure to allow mobile opt-outs can also appear here.

outbound_message.description: The message you sent to the user represented in the event.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

identifiers.description: If present, the `identifiers` object holds the value for the `sender` property.

sender.description: The sender that the `delivery_address` received a message from.

offset.description: An identifier of a location in the stream; used to resume the stream after severing a connection. If you open a stream using the offset value, the stream will resume with the next element in the stream. You should store this value as a string so that you can easily resume the stream if it ends for any reason.

processed.description: When the event was ingested by Airship. There may be some latency between when the event occurred, and when it was processed.
